segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhūnaṃ nibbānapaṭisaṃyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṃseti.
segments.en: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.

segments.pli: Te ca bhikkhū aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi katvā sabbacetasā samannāharitvā ohitasotā dhammaṃ suṇanti.
segments.en: And those mendicants were paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.

segments.pli: “ayaṃ kho samaṇo gotamo bhikkhūnaṃ nibbānapaṭisaṃyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya … pe …
segments.en: “The ascetic Gotama is giving a Dhamma talk about extinguishment … and the mendicants are listening well.

segments.pli: yannūnāhaṃ yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkameyyaṃ vicakkhukammāyā”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I go and pull the wool over their eyes?”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā kassakavaṇṇaṃ abhinimminitvā mahantaṃ naṅgalaṃ khandhe karitvā dīghapācanayaṭṭhiṃ gahetvā haṭahaṭakeso sāṇasāṭinivattho kaddamamakkhitehi pādehi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Māra the Wicked manifested in the form of a farmer carrying a large plough on his shoulder. He held a long goad, his hair was messy, he was clad in sunn hemp, and his feet were muddy. He went up to the Buddha and said to him,
“So, ascetic, did you happen to see any oxen?”
“But what have you to do with oxen, Wicked One?”

segments.pli: “Mameva, samaṇa, cakkhu, mama rūpā, mama cakkhusamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ.
segments.en: “Mine alone, ascetic, is the eye, mine are sights, mine is the field of eye contact consciousness.
Where can you escape me, ascetic?

segments.pli: Mameva, samaṇa, sotaṃ, mama saddā … pe …
mameva, samaṇa, mano, mama dhammā, mama manosamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ.
segments.en: mind, mine are thoughts, mine is the field of mind contact consciousness.
Where can you escape me, ascetic?”

segments.pli: “Taveva, pāpima, cakkhu, tava rūpā, tava cakkhusamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ.
segments.en: “Yours alone, ascetic, is the eye, yours are sights, yours is the field of eye contact consciousness.

segments.pli: Yattha ca kho, pāpima, natthi cakkhu, natthi rūpā, natthi cakkhusamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ, agati tava tattha, pāpima.
segments.en: Where there is no eye, no sights, no eye contact consciousness—you have no place there, Wicked One!

segments.pli: Taveva, pāpima, sotaṃ, tava saddā, tava sotasamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ.
Yattha ca kho, pāpima, natthi sotaṃ, natthi saddā, natthi sotasamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ, agati tava tattha, pāpima.
Taveva, pāpima, ghānaṃ, tava gandhā, tava ghānasamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ.
Yattha ca kho, pāpima, natthi ghānaṃ, natthi gandhā, natthi ghānasamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ, agati tava tattha, pāpima.
Taveva, pāpima, jivhā, tava rasā, tava jivhāsamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ … pe …
taveva, pāpima, kāyo, tava phoṭṭhabbā, tava kāyasamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ … pe …
taveva, pāpima, mano, tava dhammā, tava manosamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ.
segments.en: mind, yours are thoughts, yours is the field of mind contact consciousness.

segments.pli: Yattha ca kho, pāpima, natthi mano, natthi dhammā, natthi manosamphassaviññāṇāyatanaṃ, agati tava tattha, pāpimā”ti.
segments.en: Where there is no mind, no thoughts, no mind contact consciousness—you have no place there, Wicked One!”
“The things they speak of aren’t mine;
I’m not someone who speaks like that.
you won’t even see the path I take.”

segments.pli: Atha kho māro pāpimā … pe … tatthevantaradhāyīti.

suttaplex.blurb: While the mendicants are listening to the teachings, Māra takes the form of a farmer looking for lost oxen and addresses the Buddha.
